content.description: The Potato Eaters is perhaps Van Gogh’s most famous painting. It features a poor Dutch family eating in a rather dark room. The artist hoped this work would boost his reputation but, alas, it failed to attract much notice during his lifetime. And yet, two versions of this painting were stolen from museums. Fortunately, both were recovered.
content.location: This route lies 12 feet right of Norminator. It starts in a 20 foot long left facing dihedral, that is probably the crux.

content.description: A straight up route that doesn't wander on you. If the bottom is wet you can still make the start by staying left.  Great hands and feet for the first 3/4 of the route.  You'll be thinking it's an 8. Then the top is the 9+ part as it gets just a touch negative and you wish for more feet. Super nice, great re-climb value.

climbs.name: Missing Ear (aka Not Without an Ear)

content.description: Climbs steep black wall to sloped ledge and then ascends stellar pockets to a steep slightly overhanging finish.  Slightly run-out between 6th and 7th bolts.
content.location: This route is just right of "Can You Hear Me Now"

climbs.name: How I Sent My Summer Vacation

content.description: Start under a baby roof and either go straight up where your feet are the challenge but your hands are good, or stay a little bit right with better feet but less great hands.  There is a gorgeous side pull down low if you find it.  Once you're at the 2nd bolt the route just becomes a cruise.

A great route to practice your multi pitch skills.  1st set of anchors on a nice ledge about 20 ft up. Traverse up and to the right while grabbing some very nice pockets. You'll end up to the right of the bolt right before the ledge so lean left and clip that.  If you find the holds the top is also a lot of fun. This route has cleaned up nicely and since the first pitch is only 20 feet it's a great place to practice your multi-pitch skills.  If you want to stop at the ledge anchors I would call the bottom a 5.6.

Wall: Home to several moderates for those looking to stay under 5.10b. Feel free to practice 2 pitch climbing on Can U Hear Me Now.Routes: are roughly 50 ft tall with some nice moderates.Please provide feedback using your MP App. Star rating and rate difficulty feedback helps the next visitors use the app.
